Hi Karthik,
Probably we can do it in the finalize method, put that also in the test 
suit. I haven't tested this, but it must work.
Wants to know more about it. :->

Regards,
Seshu N.

karthikeyand wrote:

> Hi,
>    while writing tests for testing EJB code , for eg., we need to
> insert some rows (thru entity ejb) and test the creation ,
> relationships etc., but before exiting the testcase i need to remove
> the new rows (or entity objects) entered before executing the test
> case .So the creation of the rows and removing the rows are done only
> once in the test case which might contain many testXXX() methods. So
> is there a standard approach for the above said scenario.
>
> Thanks in Advance.
> Karthi
>
